t: Psalm 38
Do Not Forsake Me, O Lord
A Psalm of David, for the memorial offering.
O*pn Lord,*s rebuke me not in your anger, nor*ld discipline me in your wrath!
For*ln your arrows have sunk into me, and*ld your hand has come down on me.
There*pn is no soundness in my flesh because*ld of your indignation; there*ln is no health in my bones because*ld of my sin.
For*ln my iniquities have gone over my head; like*ld a heavy burden, they are too heavy for me.
My*pn wounds stink and fester because*ld of my foolishness,
I*ln am utterly bowed down and prostrate; all*ld the day I go about mourning.
For*ln my sides are filled with burning, and*ld there is no soundness in my flesh.
I*ln am feeble and crushed; I*ld groan because of the tumult of my heart.
O*pn Lord, all my longing is before you; my*ld sighing is not hidden from you.
My*ln heart throbs; my strength fails me, and*ld the light of my eyes— it also has gone from me.
My*ln friends and companions stand aloof from my plague, and*ld my nearest kin stand far off.
Those*pn who seek my life lay their snares; those*ld who seek my hurt speak of ruin and*ld meditate treachery all day long.
But*pn I am like a deaf man; I do not hear, like*ld a mute man who does not open his mouth.
I*ln have become like a man who does not hear, and*ld in whose mouth are no rebukes.
But*pn for you, O Lord,*s do I wait; it*ld is you, O Lord my God, who will answer.
For*ln I said, “Only let them not rejoice over me, who*ld boast against me when my foot slips!”
For*pn I am ready to fall, and*ld my pain is ever before me.
I*ln confess my iniquity; I*ld am sorry for my sin.
But*ln my foes are vigorous, they are mighty, and*ld many are those who hate me wrongfully.
Those*ln who render me evil for good accuse*ld me because I follow after good.
Do*pn not forsake me, O Lord!*s O*ld my God, be not far from me!
Make*ln haste to help me, O*ld Lord, my salvation!
